intro: Rudgea inurbana, commonly known as the urban tree, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It thrives in a variety of soil types but prefers well-drained conditions. Rudgea inurbana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to adapt to urban environments.
